page.title: 13Miss Moulston (An Interview)
page.content: Miss Moulston was born locally she went to school here, but she went to the older school, now Patterson Court. The school we go to now, used to be a reacreation ground. The High Street has changed a lot. There used to be more green grocers but now there are too many Fish & Chip shops, clothes shops, banks and estate agents. There should be a bookshop and another grocer. Miss Moulston has only one relation in Knowle, a sister-in law. Miss Moulston's brother used to work at the Royal British Legion on the Warwick Road. During the last twenty years Knowle has been greatly enlarged. It is now a thriving community of shops, offices and halls. There are a few Old People's homes in Knowle:Patterson Court, Job's Close and Bentley Heath Cottages.
